online.game
Class commonMove

java.lang.Object
  online.game.commonMove
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable, OnlineConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
CheckerMovespec, dummyMove, Hexmovespec
public abstract class commonMove
extends java.lang.Object
implements Comparable, OnlineConstants

this class is the basis for representing individual moves in the game. A few standard actions are expected, but most of the actual moves in the game should be named and parsed as required for the particular game. Standard practice is to parse strings using stringTokenizer for simplicty, but that is not required. commonMoves accept and parse strings, which may be either generated locally or incoming from the network, and generate an internal representation for use by the board. They also can print themselves in several ways, as "short" non-parseable strings for the game log, and as "long" parseable strings for transmission and creation of game records. commonMoves are also used as the currency of the robots, which use Vectors of moves and produce evaluations and other stats of each move.

Author:
ddyer

commonMove

Method Detail

Same_Move_P

public abstract boolean Same_Move_P(commonMove other)
this is used to compare two moves and determine if they are the same. This "sameness" should reflect the movement and resource changes local to the move, but not the complete state of the board. It's used to find candidates for "killer" heuristics in the search, and to detect new/not new branches in the game history.

Parameters:
other -
Returns:
true if these moves are the same move

playerString

public java.lang.String playerString()
used to tack a player id onto a move for game records

longMoveString

public java.lang.String longMoveString()
longMoveString is used for sgf format records and can contain other information intended to be ignored in the normal course of play, for example human-readable information

Copy

public abstract commonMove Copy(commonMove to)
create a copy of this move. The default method calls Copy_Slots, which is probably the method that should be overridden or wrapped.

Parameters:
to -
Returns:
a Copy of this move. This copy should include any modifications and/or annotations that were made when the move was executed.

wrap this method to augment the behavior of Copy

moveString

public abstract java.lang.String moveString()
produce a parseable move string. this string must be parseable to create a duplicate of the current move.

Returns:
a parseable string representing the move

addStandardMoves

public static void addStandardMoves(exHashtable D)
add the standard moves that most games will need. These mostly correspond to the standard buttons on the user interface. the current standard moves are "Done" "Edit" "Start" "Resign" "Reset" and indexes 0 and 1 for P0 and P1 Note that there is no standard semantics or implementation for these moves; the only effect here is to put them in the dictionary.

Parameters:
D -

showPV

public void showPV(java.lang.String msg)
this is the default method used to show "principle variations" from search results. The #numbers printed are values of Search_Driver.search_clock which can be used to trigger breakpoints.

Parameters:
msg -
